alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 20 at 9:14AM EST until January 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of one to three inches is expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Life threatening conditions for anyone that becomes trapped in these conditions. Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds will result in considerable blowing and drifting snow, with near blizzard like conditions possible at times. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
